member.name: M:Snap.UI.Block.PropertyAccess.GetPropertyValue(Snap.UI.Block.General,Snap.UI.Block.PropertyType,System.String)
member.summary: An intelligent property get function; reads from NX/Open block if it exists, otherwise from block's Property Dictionary
member.param: The block in which the property resides
Type of property to read (which NX/Open propList access function to call)
The property name (this is the NXOpen magic string)
member.returns: The property value as an "object" variable

member.name: M:Snap.UI.Block.PropertyAccess.SetPropertyValue(Snap.UI.Block.General,Snap.UI.Block.PropertyType,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: An intelligent property "set" function -- writes either to dictionary or NX/Open block, or both
member.param: The block in which the property resides
The type of the property we want to write (corresponds to NX/Open access function)
The property name (this is the NXOpen magic string)
The property value we want to write

remarks.para: Allows writing of "null' to a property value. This is useful for clearing array properties.

member.name: M:Snap.UI.Block.PropertyAccess.SetDictionaryValue(Snap.UI.Block.General,Snap.UI.Block.PropertyType,System.String,System.Object,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{Snap.UI.Block.PropertyKey,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets a value in a Property Dictionary, with correct handling of reference types (arrays)
member.param: The block in which the property resides
The type of the property we want to write (corresponds to NX/Open access function)
The property name (this is the NXOpen magic string)
The property value we want to write
The dictionary into which we want to write

remarks.para: Allows writing of "null' to a property value. This is useful for clearing array properties.

member.name: M:Snap.UI.Block.PropertyAccess.SetNxopenBlockValue(Snap.UI.Block.General,Snap.UI.Block.PropertyType,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Writes a property value into an NX/Open block, which is assumed to exist already
member.param: The Snap.UI.Block containing the NX/Open block
Type of property to write (which NX/Open propList access function to call)
Name of property to write (the NX/Open magic string)
The property value in an "object" variable

remarks.para: You can't write the "Type" property. And you shouldn't need to, because it's correct from the outset.

member.name: T:Snap.UI.Block.PropertyType
member.summary: Types of properties

remarks.para: The types correspond the NX/Open get/set functions. The type tells us which Get/Set functions to call. Note the complications with Enums.

member.name: T:Snap.UI.Block.PropertyKey
member.summary: The key used in Property Dictionaries

remarks.para: We can't use just the property name as a key because there are cases where a given block has several properties with the same name (but different types)

member.name: T:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet
member.summary: An object that records the states of various snap point options
member.example: This example shows how to use a SnapPointsStateSet:

member.name: F:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.numOptions
member.summary: The number of snap point options

member.name: F:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.OwnerBlock
member.summary: The block that owns this StateSet

remarks.para: The block must be of a type that has SnapPointsEnabled and SnapPointsOnByDefault properties

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.OptionArray
member.summary: Array of option settings

remarks.para:
The correspondence between array positions and snap point options is as follows:
array[0] : UserDefined
array[1] : Inferred
array[2] : ScreenPosition
array[3] : EndPoint
array[4] : MidPoint
array[5] : ControlPoint
array[6] : Intersection
array[7] : ArcCenter
array[8] : QuadrantPoint
array[9] : ExistingPoint
array[10] : PointOnCurve
array[11] : PointOnSurface
array[12] : PointConstructor
array[13] : TwoCurveIntersection
array[14] : TangentPoint
array[15] : Pole
array[16] : BoundedGridPoint

member.name: M:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.IntToBools(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert an integer bit-mask to an array of booleans
member.param: Number of bits to use from integer
member.returns: Array of booleans; bool[i] = true iff bits[i] = 1

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.UserDefined
member.summary: Controls the use of the "User Defined" option for specifying positions

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.Inferred
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Inferred" option for specifying positions
member.remarks:
This option allows positions to be specified by inferencing. In other words, the
system will intelligently guess which option the user wants.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.ScreenPosition
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Screen Position" or "Cursor Location" option for specifying positions
member.remarks: This option allows the user to specify a position on the Work Plane using the cursor.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.EndPoint
member.summary: Controls the use of the "End Point" option for specifying points
member.remarks: This option allows the user to specify a point at the end of a curve or edge.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.MidPoint
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Midpoint" option for specifying positions

remarks.para: This option allows the user to specify a position halfway along a curve (or edge). Only linear and circular curves are supported. Closed curves are not supported.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.ControlPoint
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Control Point" option for specifying positions

remarks.para: This option is a combination of end-points, mid-points, existing points, and spline knot-points.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.Intersection
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Intersection" option for specifying positions

remarks.para: This option allows the user to specify a position at the intersection of two curves with a single click. The two curves must physically intersect in 3D space.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.ArcCenter
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Arc Center" option for specifying positions
member.remarks: This option allows the user to specify a position at the center of an arc or an ellipse.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.QuadrantPoint
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Quadrant Point" option for specifying positions
member.remarks:
This option allows the user to specify a position at a quadrant point on an arc or an ellipse
(a point at 0, 90, 180, or 270 degrees).

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.ExistingPoint
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Existing Point" option for specifying positions
member.remarks: This option allows the user to specify a position by selecting an existing point object.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.PointOnCurve
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Point on Curve" option for specifying positions
member.remarks: This option allows the user to specify a position on a curve with the cursor.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.PointOnSurface
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Point on Face" option for specifying positions
member.remarks: This option allows the user to specify a position on a face with the cursor.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.PointConstructor
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Point Constructor" option for specifying positions
member.remarks: This option allows the user to specify a position using the Point Constructor dialog.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.TwoCurveIntersection
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Two Curve Intersection" option for specifying positions

remarks.para: This option allows the user to specify a position at the intersection of two curves, which are selected one at a time. The two curves do not need to physically intersect in 3D space. The second curve is swept parallel to the ZC-axis to obtain a "projected" intersection. So, the intersection will lie on the first curve, but not necessarily on the second one.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.TangentPoint
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Tangent Point" option for specifying positions

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.Pole
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Pole" option for specifying positions

remarks.para: This option allows the user to specify a position at a pole (control vertex) of a spline or a b-surface.

member.name: P:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.BoundedGridPoint
member.summary: Controls the use of the "Point on Bounded Grid" option for specifying positions

remarks.para: This option allows the user to specify a position by snapping the cursor location to a datum plane grid or a view section grid.

member.name: M:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.SetAllSnapPointStates(Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointState)
member.summary: Set all snap point states to be hidden, shown, or selected
member.param: Snap point state to be applied

member.name: M:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.SetAll(Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointState)
member.summary: Set all snap point states to be hidden, shown, or selected
member.param: Snap point state to be applied

remarks.para: This function does exactly the same thing as SetAllSnapPointStates. It's just easier to type and easier to read.

member.name: M:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.DeselectAllShown
member.summary: Change the state of all "Selected" options to "Shown"

remarks.para: This function is useful in OnShow functions. You can use it there to deselect all selected options, and then individually select the ones you want. You can't do this conveniently with the SetAll function.

member.name: M:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointsStateSet.SelectAllShown
member.summary: Change the state of all "Shown" options to "Selected"

member.name: T:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointState
member.summary: The three possible states of a snap point option

member.name: F:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointState.Hidden
member.summary: Not shown on toolbar, so not available.

member.name: F:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointState.Shown
member.summary: Shown on toolbar. Available, but not chosen.

member.name: F:Snap.UI.Block.SnapPointState.Selected
member.summary: Shown on toolbar, and depressed (selected for use)

member.name: T:Snap.UI.NamespaceDoc
